name: Wrestling Thunder City: Battle Prototype
description:
Yes sir, we promised you a great match!

"Probably the best game in history" - A friend of mine.

"This game is the bee's knees" - My Granny.

"Can you stop doing that and help me with stuff?" - Wife.

"If I caught you again working on your videogame during office hours I'll go Mr. McMahon and fire your ass!" - My boss.

Welcome to the first combat prototype for the upcoming Wrestling Thunder City Gameboy homebrew videogame.  I sincerely hope you enjoy it.

Wrestling Thunder City is a wrestling-themed , top-down RPG for retro games enthusiasts and wrestling fans alike, with the main purpose of depicting what's life outside the ring more than keeping it in there. 

A few words about me, I'm from Santiago, Chile and I just love videogames and wrestling in general.  I wanted to give it a try at learning the ropes (no pun intended) of game development with GB Studio as with all the limitations it has it can only make your brain work harder at being creative and also, to keep the scope in check. I don't have a programmer or pixel art background so definitely the art is not final (it even contains borrowed art from GB Studio template!) and the rest of the gameplay needs a lot of polish and features (like limiting the use of attacks with an stamina bar for instance) as for the moment I'm limited by the science of my era (or my brain to be exact). 

For the music, I tag teamed (no pun intended I swear!) with TipTopTomCat who has done a badass work with the chiptunes. Hope you enjoy his music and I invite you to visit his twitter @TomcatTiptop.  

Check out the amazing first volume of the soundtrack at:

SoundCloud

In the meantime I'll keep learning as much as I can for you guys to get a demo version this year! Kindly report any bugs or glitches you might find. Feedback is greatly appreciated!

Cheers!
